item.title: THQ Nordic Releases “The Making of Gothic 1 Remake” Video
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/thq-nordic-releases-the-making-of-gothic-1-remake-video/

Today, THQ Nordic has released the first making-of video for the highly anticipated Gothic 1 Remake. The video has the title "Chapter 1: The Essence of Gothic" and provides a behind-the-scenes look at the development of Gothic and how Alkimia Interactive is working to reimagine the cult classic. There will be more information about the Gothic 1 Remake during the Steam Next Fest, which takes place from February 24 to March 3. If you want to watch the video on the Gothic 1 Remake, you can check it out below. The video is just over 13 minutes, providing you with plenty of info about the upcoming remake.

In the video, you will see insights from some of the key team members. This includes Reinhard Pollice (Head of Studio & Game Director), Kai Rosenkranz (Music Composer & Sound Designer), and Daniel Candil (Studio Art Director), where they go into detail about their dedication to making a faithful remake of Gothic and the vision they have as a team for this game.

For the first chapter of these dev diaries, the video goes into depth about the creative process behind the remake, where you'll get to see how the team decides to balance making a faithful remake but also making sure that the game is playable for a modern audience. This includes updating graphics and music and also keeping the story in line with what a modern audience would want.

In the video, the audience will get to see glimpses of some of the most well-known locations from the original Gothic title, as well as being walked through some updated sequences that will appear in the remake. This is done to illuminate the way the world has changed and evolved but also remains faithful to the locations from the original. The remake promises to be more detailed than the original and will be rich in atmosphere for those who choose to play it.

The feature makes sure to focus on the passion the team is bringing to the project, the intricate craftsmanship in their development, and how committed they are to creating a remake that is true to the original Gothic.

So far, the Gothic 1 Remake doesn't have a release date, but the game is available to be wishlisted on Steam, as well as a Collector's Edition available for those who want to showcase their favorite game.

Will you be playing the Gothic 1 Remake when it eventually releases? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: Dark Souls 3 Seamless Co-Op Mod Promises to Rejuvenate The Game’s Multiplayer Mechanics
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/dark-souls-3-seamless-co-op-mod/

A new Dark Souls 3 mod now in development promises to rejuvenate the game's multiplayer mechanics in the same way a similar mod does in Elden Ring.

LukeYui, the developer behind the Elden Ring Seamless Co-op mod released a while back, is currently working on a similar mod for the third entry in the now classic FromSoftware series, which will allow players to enjoy the entirety of the game together with friends from beginning to end with synchronized progress, no resummoning and optional invasions, essentially removing every vanilla multiplayer restriction. You can check out the seamless multiplayer experience coming in the future to Dark Souls 3 in the video below.

Despite the game having been released a while back, the Dark Souls 3 modding community continues to be extremely active and is continuing to introduce all sorts of improvements to the game. Fromsoftserve, the developer behind the excellent Bloodborne Remastered Project, recently released a visual overhaul mod that carries over much of the work made on the emulated PlayStation 4 game to offer improvements that are worthy of an official remaster.

Dark Souls 3 is now available on PC, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. You can learn more about the game by checking out our review.
